Blog.post: Winnion has arrived safely in India and is actually enjoying herself quite a lot. I am writing this from an internet cafe which is just dandy. Today is my fourth day her and I still have another six to go. We have bought all the sarees and given them to tailors to make my costumes. We have also been to some printers and had a meeting with a designer to design some invitation cards. Now that all the work is done we can just wander aimlessly around shopping centres and sit in our hotel room and watch terrible repeats of really bad programmes. I do love it so though. Overall I am having a much better time than I had anticipated but I can't wait to get back home. I didn't bring my digital camera with me so I will put up some pictures once they are developed. Luv, Winnie

Look what I just bought. Oh the lovelies! I am leaving for India in one hour but I felt the need to share my feelings of utmost joy at my purchase. I really want to say a huge thank-you to Farha who inspired me and also told me where to get them. Of course I would also like to thank my mum for taking me to buy them about one and a half hours before leaving to go on holiday. Bye bye all you beautiful people. ~Winnion~

I got back from Canterbury yesterday after a week's trip. it was very enjoyable. We sang Evensong every day and did the Sunday morning service. Add in lots of three hour rehearsals and you have a recipe for fun! i was most honoured to share a room with Ellie and it was kept very tidy for the whole week. *cough cogh* Overall it was an extremely enjoyable trip as we were allowed to go anwhere we wanted entirely by ourselves for hours on end. yay for Mrs Jewell. The only thing that disenhanced the trip was Gail. Don't want to talk about it.
